meanings.definition: To question or challenge someone, especially in a formal setting.
meanings.sent1: During the debate, the moderator interpellates the candidates to test their knowledge.
meanings.sent2: The teacher interpellates the students to ensure they understand the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The parrot interpellates the visitors by mimicking their words.
meanings.sent4: The detective interpellates the suspect, trying to uncover the truth.
meanings.sent5: The judge interpellates the witness to clarify the events.

meanings.definition: To interrupt or disrupt a conversation or event.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise from outside interpellates our meeting.
meanings.sent2: Please do not interpellate when someone is speaking.
meanings.sent3: The barking dog interpellates the peaceful atmosphere of the park.
meanings.sent4: The sudden rain interpellates the outdoor party, forcing everyone to seek shelter.
meanings.sent5: The phone call interpellates the flow of our discussion.

meanings.definition: To call attention to or address someone directly.
meanings.sent1: The speaker interpellates the audience by asking thought-provoking questions.
meanings.sent2: When you raise your hand, the teacher will interpellate you for your answer.
meanings.sent3: The toddler interpellates his parents by tugging at their sleeves.
meanings.sent4: The leader interpellates the team members to discuss the upcoming project.
meanings.sent5: The singer interpellates the crowd by making eye contact with different audience members.
